channel.title: Projects on L.G Mngadi
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on L.G Mngadi

item.title: Git Recipe
item.description: The idea So what exactly is Git Recipe. It is Github but for recipes… To me that says a lot, I mean already I can see it “git pull Beef Stew”, but you’re not in my head so lets go over it together. Git recipe is a website where you can search recipes, but unlike all other sites you can save these recepies, then customize them to your liking.

item.title: Table of content
item.description: Table of content This theme supports displaying table of content (ToC) in blog posts. Parameters You can manage a ToC with two parameters: global toc parameter; post toc parameter. The post toc parameter has higher priority than the global toc parameter. Enable table of content on all posts To enable ToC on all posts (globally) set parameter toc to true in config.toml. [params] toc = true To disable ToC globally, simply ignore the toc parameter or set it to false.

item.title: Math Typesetting - use Mathematical notation in blog posts
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
